greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Numerator of sum of all matrix elements of N X N matrix M(i,j) = i^3+j^3, (i,j = 1..n) divided by n!.
comment: Sum M(i,j) (i,j = 1..n) is A099903(n). a(n) is an irregular sequence with highest champions belonging to Pentagonal pyramidal numbers n^2*(n+1)/2 (A002411) and n/2*(n+1)^2 (A006002).
formula: a(n) = Numerator[1/n!*Sum[Sum[(i^3+j^3), {i, 1, n}], {j, 1, n}]] a(n) = Numerator[1/2 * (n^3)*(n+1)^2 /n! ].
mathematica: Table[ Numerator[ Sum[(i^3 + j^3), {i, n}, {j, n}]/n! ], {n, 60}]
results.author: _Alexander Adamchuk_, Oct 29 2004
